Service.Name: WMS
Service.Title: BGS Groundwater
Service.Abstract: The Africa Groundwater Atlas is an online resource developed by the BGS, in collaboration with hydrogeologists across Africa. This service presents layers showing the hydrogeology (aquifer type and productivity) and geology (with particular reference to hydrogeology) of 38 African countries.
Service.AccessConstraints: The Africa Groundwater Atlas country hydrogeology maps are released under a Creative Commons ‘Attribution/Share Alike’ (CC BY SA) licence. A summary of the terms of this licence is available at : https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/ The full legal text of this licence is available at : https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/legalcode Under this licence, you are free to : Share — copy and redistribute the material in any medium or format Adapt — remix, transform, and build upon the material for any purpose, even commercially. The licensor (the British Geological Survey) cannot revoke these freedoms as long as you follow the license terms. Under the following terms: Attribution — You must give appropriate credit, provide a link to the license, and indicate if changes were made. You may do so in any reasonable manner, but not in any way that suggests the licensor endorses you or your use. ShareAlike — If you remix, transform, or build upon the material, you must distribute your contributions under the same license as the original. There must be no additional restrictions if you share any works based on these maps. You may not apply legal terms or technological measures that legally restrict others from doing anything the license permits.

Layer.Name: ZWE_BGS_5M_Hydrogeology
Layer.Title: ZWE BGS 1:5M Hydrogeology
Layer.Abstract: Overview of the Hydrogeology of Zimbabwe at 1:5 million scale with categories that combine aquifer type and productivity.

Layer.Name: ZWE_BGS_5M_Geology
Layer.Title: ZWE BGS 1:5M Geology
Layer.Abstract: Overview o the Geology of Zimbabwe at 1:5 million scale with geological categories that reflect significant hydrogeological units.
